TextSection.Contents: A rare tumor of endocrine glands characterized by a sporadic, extra-adrenal, catecholamine-secreting, chromaffin cell tumor located anywhere along the sympathetic ganglia (most frequently in the abdomen and pelvis), typically manifesting with episodic hypertension, cephalea, diaphoresis, heart palpitations, and, occasionally, hyperglycemia, anxiety/panic attacks, fever, weight loss, myocardial infarction, osteolytic bone metastases, and Raynaud's phenomenon.
